HTML.Question: What is the purpose of the `<div>` element in HTML?
Answers: To divide the HTML document into sections

HTML.Question: What does the `<!DOCTYPE html>` declaration do?
Answers: It defines the document type and version of HTML

HTML.Question: What is the correct HTML element for inserting a line break?
What is the purpose of the `<meta>` tag in HTML?
Answers: To provide metadata about the HTML document

HTML.Question: What is the purpose of the `href` attribute in an `<a>` element in HTML?
Answers: To specify the URL or destination that the link should navigate to when clicked

CSS.Question: Where in an HTML document is the correct place to refer to an external style sheet?
Answers: At the end of the document

Checks if two values are not equal

JS.Question: What does `==` operator do in JavaScript?
Answers: Checks if two values are equal
Checks if two values are not equal
Checks if two values are the same type
Checks if two values are not the same type

JS.Question: What does `!=` operator do in JavaScript?
Answers: Checks if two values are not equal
Checks if two values are equal
Checks if two values are the same type
Checks if two values are not the same type

JS.Question: What does `!==` operator do in JavaScript?

Checks if two values are equal
Checks if two values are not the same type
Checks if two values are the same type
